label: 弁官局
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the Office of Controllers, which in the eighth century provided staff support to the Council of State while mediating with the Council, ministries, and provinces. By early Heian times, the office was charged with overseeing the writing out and execution of royal directives.
